questions.label: Do you plan to interact with the participants during the experiment?
Is it possible for participants to have prior knowledge of the experiment's hypotheses?
Was there a definition of a guide, method or protocol for data measurement?
Is it possible that the defined metric(s) does not represent the real effect?
Will only one metric be used to answer survey questions?
The confidence interval used may not be appropriate to draw conclusions?
Will there be participants with different levels of experience or abilities in any task to be performed during the experiment?
Will there be participants with different gender, personality or other characteristics?
Is the language of the participants different from the language of the experimental material?
Will participants handle more than one treatment?
Will participants receive any kind of reward for participating in the experiment?
Is it possible that the participants who will be selected have participated in similar studies previously?
May there be lack of motivation for participants to participate in the study?
Is it possible that one of the participants leaves the experiment?
May there be communication between the participants during the experiment?
Will collect data from participants via characterization and/or demographic questionnaire?
May the participants not represent the target population?
Can the size of the selected sample be considered small?
May events occur in the experimental environment that can influence the performance of the participants?
The experimental devices and procedures (tools, materials, technologies, tools, tasks, etc.) may not represent those used in the actual context?
The experimental procedures (tools, materials, technologies, tools, etc.) are different for a group of participants?
Among the experimental artifacts of the experiment is there the use of a requirements document?
If its context is for inspection, will it be necessary to insert defects in the artifacts?
The tasks to be performed by the groups are different?
The tasks to be performed will be developed by the researchers?
The treatments used in the experiment may not represent those normally used in the real context?
Is there the possibility of using a treatment influence other treatments?
Will each group use only an experimental artifact, or task, or treatment?
The environment in which the experiment will be conducted can not represent the actual context of the study?
Is the experiment conducted in different experimental environments?
It will be allowed interval between runs of the experiment?
The training given to the participants and/or groups will be taught by different people?
Is there a risk that some of the participants do not understand or are not sufficiently familiar with the experimental material?
Is it possible that the pilot study is not sufficient to reveal possible problems with the execution of the experiment?
Will a time limit be determined for the execution of the experiment activities?
Will there be a description of the events and an order of presentation of the experimental material for the participants?
Is there the possibility of the data that will be collected are not complete, accurate and/or reliable?
Do you plan to include observant researchers during the experiment?
Will any set of procedures, protocol or method be used for data analysis?
Will any procedure be used to resolve possible disagreements in data analysis?
Do you describe/reference the procedures and criteria that support the statistical rigor of the study?
If your experiment is a replication, will there be a change in the experimental package from the original study?
Do you plan to submit or indicate where the raw data from your experiment will be available?
